00056 void EGS_BaseSpectrum::reportAverageEnergy() const {
00057     egsInformation("expected average energy: %g\n",expectedAverage());
00058     EGS_Float e=0,de=0;
00059     getSampledAverage(e,de);
00060     egsInformation("sampled  average energy: %g +/- %g\n",e,de);
00061 }

00075 class EGS_EXPORT EGS_MonoEnergy : public EGS_BaseSpectrum {
00076 
00077 public:
00078 
00080     EGS_MonoEnergy(EGS_Float energy) : EGS_BaseSpectrum(), E(energy) {
00081         char buf[1024];
00082         sprintf(buf,"monoenergetic %g MeV",E);
00083         type = buf;
00084     };
00085     ~EGS_MonoEnergy() {};
00086     EGS_Float expectedAverage() const {
00087         return E;
00088     };
00089     EGS_Float maxEnergy() const {
00090         return E;
00091     };
00092 
00093 protected:
00094 
00095     EGS_Float sample(EGS_RandomGenerator *) {
00096         return E;
00097     };
00098 
00099     EGS_Float E; 
00100 
00101 };
00102 
00103 static inline EGS_Float getGaussianRN(EGS_RandomGenerator *rndm) {
00104     static bool have_x = false;
00105     static EGS_Float the_x;
00106     if (have_x) {
00107         have_x = false;
00108         return the_x;
00109     }
00110     EGS_Float r = sqrt(-2*log(1-rndm->getUniform()));
00111     EGS_Float cphi, sphi;
00112     rndm->getAzimuth(cphi,sphi);
00113     the_x = r*sphi;
00114     have_x = true;
00115     return r*cphi;
00116 };
00117 
00134 class EGS_EXPORT EGS_GaussianSpectrum : public EGS_BaseSpectrum {
00135 
00136 public:
00137 
00144     EGS_GaussianSpectrum(EGS_Float mean_energy, EGS_Float Sigma) :
00145         EGS_BaseSpectrum(), Eo(mean_energy), sigma(Sigma) {
00146         if (Eo <= 0) egsFatal("EGS_GaussianSpectrum: attempt to construct "
00147                                   "a spectrum with a negative mean energy (%g)\n",Eo);
00148         if (sigma < 0) {
00149             sigma = -sigma*0.4246609;    // i.e. assume
00150         }
00151         // the user has specified FWHM
00152         char buf[1024];
00153         sprintf(buf,"Gaussian spectrum with Eo = %g and sigma = %g",Eo,sigma);
00154         type = buf;
00155         if (Eo - 5*sigma > 0) {
00156             Emax = Eo + 5*sigma;
00157         }
00158         else {
00159             Emax = 2*Eo;
00160         }
00161     };
00162     ~EGS_GaussianSpectrum() {};
00163     EGS_Float expectedAverage() const {
00164         return Eo;
00165     };
00166     EGS_Float maxEnergy() const {
00167         return Emax;
00168     };
00169 
00170 protected:
00171 
00172     EGS_Float sample(EGS_RandomGenerator *rndm) {
00173         EGS_Float E;
00174         do {
00175             E = Eo + sigma*getGaussianRN(rndm);
00176         }
00177         while (E <= 0 || E > Emax);
00178         return E;
00179     };
00180 
00181     EGS_Float  Eo;    
00182     EGS_Float  sigma; 
00183 
00189     EGS_Float  Emax;
00190 };
00191 
00214 class EGS_EXPORT EGS_DoubleGaussianSpectrum : public EGS_BaseSpectrum {
00215 
00216 public:
00217 
00221     EGS_DoubleGaussianSpectrum(EGS_Float mean_energy, EGS_Float sig_left,
00222                                EGS_Float sig_right) : EGS_BaseSpectrum(), Eo(mean_energy),
00223         sleft(sig_left), sright(sig_right) {
00224         if (sleft < 0) {
00225             sleft = -sleft*0.4246609;
00226         }
00227         if (sright< 0) {
00228             sright= -sright*0.4246609;
00229         }
00230         Emax = Eo + 4*sright;
00231         if (Eo - 4*sleft < 0) egsWarning("EGS_DoubleGaussianSpectrum: "
00232                                              "for Eo=%g, sigma=%g there will be negative energy sampled\n");
00233         p = sleft/(sleft + sright);
00234         char buf[1024];
00235         sprintf(buf,"Double Gaussian spectrum with Eo = %g sig(left) = %g"
00236                 " and sig(right) = %g",Eo,sleft,sright);
00237         type = buf;
00238     };
00239     ~EGS_DoubleGaussianSpectrum() {};
00240     EGS_Float maxEnergy() const {
00241         return Emax;
00242     };
00243     EGS_Float expectedAverage() const {
00244         return Eo + sqrt(2/M_PI)*(sright-sleft);
00245     };
00246 
00247 protected:
00248 
00249     EGS_Float Eo;     
00250     EGS_Float Emax;   
00251     EGS_Float sleft;  
00252     EGS_Float sright; 
00253     EGS_Float p;      
00256     EGS_Float sample(EGS_RandomGenerator *rndm) {
00257         EGS_Float E;
00258         if (rndm->getUniform() < p) {
00259             do {
00260                 E = Eo-sleft*fabs(getGaussianRN(rndm));
00261             }
00262             while (E <= 0);
00263         }
00264         else {
00265             do {
00266                 E = Eo+sright*fabs(getGaussianRN(rndm));
00267             }
00268             while (E > Emax);
00269         }
00270         return E;
00271     };
00272 
00273 };

00293 class EGS_EXPORT EGS_UniformSpectrum : public EGS_BaseSpectrum {
00294 
00295 public:
00296 
00298     EGS_UniformSpectrum(EGS_Float emin, EGS_Float emax) : EGS_BaseSpectrum(),
00299         Emin(emin), Emax(emax), de(emax - emin) {
00300         char buf[1024];
00301         sprintf(buf,"Uniform spectrum with Emin = %g Emax = %g",Emin,Emax);
00302         type = buf;
00303     };
00304     ~EGS_UniformSpectrum() {};
00305     EGS_Float maxEnergy() const {
00306         return Emax;
00307     };
00308     EGS_Float expectedAverage() const {
00309         return (Emin+Emax)/2;
00310     };
00311 
00312 protected:
00313 
00314     EGS_Float sample(EGS_RandomGenerator *rndm) {
00315         return Emin + rndm->getUniform()*de;
00316     };
00317 
00318     EGS_Float Emin;  
00319     EGS_Float Emax;  
00320     EGS_Float de;    
00321 };

00375 class EGS_EXPORT EGS_TabulatedSpectrum : public EGS_BaseSpectrum {
00376 
00377 public:
00378 
00393     EGS_TabulatedSpectrum(int N, const EGS_Float *x, const EGS_Float *f,
00394                           int Type = 1, const char *fname = 0) : EGS_BaseSpectrum(),
00395         table(new EGS_AliasTable(N,x,f,Type)) {
00396         setType(Type,fname);
00397     };
00398 
00399     ~EGS_TabulatedSpectrum() {
00400         delete table;
00401     };
00402     EGS_Float maxEnergy() const {
00403         return table->getMaximum();
00404     };
00405     EGS_Float expectedAverage() const {
00406         return table->getAverage();
00407     };
00408 
00409 protected:
00410 
00411     EGS_AliasTable *table; 
00412     void setType(int Type,const char *fname) {
00413         if (Type == 0) {
00414             type = "tabulated line spectrum";
00415         }
00416         else if (Type == 1) {
00417             type = "tabulated histogram spectrum";
00418         }
00419         else {
00420             type = "tabulated spectrum";
00421         }
00422         if (fname) {
00423             type += " defined in ";
00424             type += fname;
00425         }
00426         else {
00427             type += " defined inline";
00428         }
00429     };
00430 
00431     EGS_Float sample(EGS_RandomGenerator *rndm) {
00432         return table->sample(rndm);
00433     };
00434 
00435 };
00436 
00437 static char spec_msg1[] = "EGS_BaseSpectrum::createSpectrum:";
00438 
00439 //
00440 // The following function is used to skip potentially present
00441 // commas as separators in spectrum files. With it we can write
00442 //   stream >> input1 >> skipsep >> input2;
00443 // and it will work for white space and for comma separated input.
00444 //
00445 istream &skipsep(istream &in) {
00446     char c;
00447     while (1) {
00448         in.get(c);
00449         if (in.eof() || in.fail() || !in.good()) {
00450             break;
00451         }
00452         if (c == ',') {
00453             break;
00454         }
00455         if (!isspace(c)) {
00456             in.putback(c);
00457             break;
00458         }
00459     }
00460     return in;
00461 }
00462 
00463 
00464 EGS_BaseSpectrum *EGS_BaseSpectrum::createSpectrum(EGS_Input *input) {
00465     if (!input) {
00466         egsWarning("%s got null input?\n",spec_msg1);
00467         return 0;
00468     }
00469     EGS_Input *inp = input;
00470     bool delete_it = false;
00471     if (!input->isA("spectrum")) {
00472         inp = input->takeInputItem("spectrum");
00473         if (!inp) {
00474             egsWarning("%s no 'spectrum' input!\n",spec_msg1);
00475             return 0;
00476         }
00477         delete_it = true;
00478     }
00479     string stype;
00480     int err = inp->getInput("type",stype);
00481     if (err) {
00482         egsWarning("%s wrong/missing 'type' input\n",spec_msg1);
00483         if (delete_it) {
00484             delete inp;
00485         }
00486         return 0;
00487     }
00488     EGS_BaseSpectrum *spec = 0;
00489     if (inp->compare(stype,"monoenergetic")) {
00490         EGS_Float Eo;
00491         err = inp->getInput("energy",Eo);
00492         if (err) egsWarning("%s wrong/missing 'energy' input for a "
00493                                 "monoenergetic spectrum\n",spec_msg1);
00494         else {
00495             spec = new EGS_MonoEnergy(Eo);
00496         }
00497     }
00498     else if (inp->compare(stype,"Gaussian")) {
00499         EGS_Float Eo, sig, fwhm;
00500         int err1 = inp->getInput("mean energy",Eo);
00501         int err2 = inp->getInput("sigma",sig);
00502         int err3 = inp->getInput("fwhm",fwhm);
00503         if (err1 || (err2 && err3)) {
00504             if (err1) egsWarning("%s wrong/missing 'mean energy' input"
00505                                      " for a Gaussian spectrum\n",spec_msg1);
00506             else egsWarning("%s wrong/missing 'sigma' and 'FWHM' input for a "
00507                                 "Gaussian spectrum\n",spec_msg1);
00508 
00509         }
00510         else {
00511             if (Eo <= 0) egsWarning("%s mean energy must be positive but your"
00512                                         " input was %g\n",Eo);
00513             else {
00514                 if (!err2) {
00515                     if (sig <= 0) egsWarning("%s sigma must be positive"
00516                                                  " but your input was %g\n",spec_msg1,sig);
00517                     else {
00518                         spec = new EGS_GaussianSpectrum(Eo,sig);
00519                     }
00520                 }
00521                 else {
00522                     if (fwhm <= 0)  egsWarning("%s FWHM must be positive"
00523                                                    " but your input was %g\n",spec_msg1,fwhm);
00524                     else {
00525                         spec = new EGS_GaussianSpectrum(Eo,-fwhm);
00526                     }
00527                 }
00528             }
00529         }
00530     }
00531     else if (inp->compare(stype,"Double Gaussian")) {
00532         EGS_Float Eo;
00533         vector<EGS_Float> sig, fwhm;
00534         int err1 = inp->getInput("mean energy",Eo);
00535         int err2 = inp->getInput("sigma",sig);
00536         int err3 = inp->getInput("fwhm",fwhm);
00537         if (!err1 && Eo <= 0) {
00538             err1 = 1;
00539         }
00540         if (!err2 && sig.size() != 2) {
00541             err2 = 1;
00542         }
00543         if (!err2 && (sig[0] <= 0 || sig[1] <= 0)) {
00544             err2 = 1;
00545         }
00546         if (!err3 && fwhm.size() != 2) {
00547             err3 = 1;
00548         }
00549         if (!err3 && (fwhm[0] <= 0 || fwhm[1] <= 0)) {
00550             err3 = 1;
00551         }
00552         if (err1 || (err2 && err3)) {
00553             if (err1) egsWarning("%s wrong/missing 'mean energy' input"
00554                                      " for a Double Gaussian spectrum\n",spec_msg1);
00555             if (err2 && err3) egsWarning("%s wrong/missing 'sigma' and 'FWHM'"
00556                                              " input for a Double Gaussian spectrum\n",spec_msg1);
00557         }
00558         else {
00559             if (!err2 && !err3) egsWarning("%s found 'sigma' and 'FWHM' "
00560                                                "input, using 'sigma'\n",spec_msg1);
00561             if (!err2) {
00562                 spec = new EGS_DoubleGaussianSpectrum(Eo,sig[0],sig[1]);
00563             }
00564             else {
00565                 spec = new EGS_DoubleGaussianSpectrum(Eo,-fwhm[0],-fwhm[1]);
00566             }
00567         }
00568     }
00569     else if (inp->compare(stype,"uniform")) {
00570         vector<EGS_Float> range;
00571         EGS_Float Emin, Emax;
00572         int err1 = inp->getInput("range",range);
00573         int err2 = inp->getInput("minimum energy",Emin);
00574         int err3 = inp->getInput("maximum energy",Emax);
00575         if (!err2 && !err3 && Emin > Emax) {
00576             egsWarning("%s Emin (%g) is greater than Emax (%g)?\n",
00577                        spec_msg1,Emin,Emax);
00578             err2 = 1;
00579             err3 = 1;
00580         }
00581         if (err1 && err2 && err3) egsWarning("%s wrong/missing 'range' and"
00582                                                  " 'minimum/maximum energy' input\n",spec_msg1);
00583         else {
00584             if (!err2 && !err3) {
00585                 spec = new EGS_UniformSpectrum(Emin,Emax);
00586             }
00587             else {
00588                 if (range[0] < range[1]) {
00589                     spec = new EGS_UniformSpectrum(range[0],range[1]);
00590                 }
00591                 else {
00592                     spec = new EGS_UniformSpectrum(range[1],range[0]);
00593                 }
00594             }
00595         }
00596     }
00597     else if (inp->compare(stype,"tabulated spectrum")) {
00598         string spec_file;
00599         err = inp->getInput("spectrum file",spec_file);
00600         if (!err) {
00601             ifstream sdata(spec_file.c_str());
00602             if (!sdata) egsWarning("%s failed to open spectrum file %s\n",
00603                                        spec_msg1,spec_file.c_str());
00604             else {
00605                 char title[1024];
00606                 sdata.getline(title,1023);
00607                 if (sdata.eof() || sdata.fail() || !sdata.good()) {
00608                     egsWarning("%s error while reading title of spectrum file"
00609                                "%s\n",spec_msg1,spec_file.c_str());
00610                     if (delete_it) {
00611                         delete inp;
00612                     }
00613                     return 0;
00614                 }
00615                 if (sdata.eof() || sdata.fail() || !sdata.good()) {
00616                     egsWarning("%s error while reading spectrum type and "
00617                                "number of bins in spectrum file %s\n",
00618                                spec_msg1,spec_file.c_str());
00619                     if (delete_it) {
00620                         delete inp;
00621                     }
00622                     return 0;
00623                 }
00624                 EGS_Float dum;
00625                 int nbin, mode;
00626                 sdata >> nbin >> skipsep >> dum >> skipsep >> mode;
00627                 if (sdata.eof() || sdata.fail() || !sdata.good()) {
00628                     egsWarning("%s error while reading spectrum type and "
00629                                "number of bins in spectrum file %s\n",
00630                                spec_msg1,spec_file.c_str());
00631                     if (delete_it) {
00632                         delete inp;
00633                     }
00634                     return 0;
00635                 }
00636                 if (nbin < 2) {
00637                     egsWarning("%s nbin in a spectrum must be at least 2\n"
00638                                "  you have %d in the spectrum file %s\n",
00639                                spec_msg1,nbin,spec_file.c_str());
00640                     if (delete_it) {
00641                         delete inp;
00642                     }
00643                     return 0;
00644                 }
00645                 if (mode < 0 || mode > 3) {
00646                     egsWarning("%s unknown spectrum type %d in spectrum file"
00647                                " %s\n",spec_msg1,mode,spec_file.c_str());
00648                     if (delete_it) {
00649                         delete inp;
00650                     }
00651                     return 0;
00652                 }
00653                 EGS_Float *en_array, *f_array;
00654                 int ibin;
00655                 f_array = new EGS_Float [nbin];
00656                 if (mode == 0 || mode == 1) {
00657                     en_array = new EGS_Float [nbin+1];
00658                     en_array[0] = dum;
00659                     ibin=1;
00660                 }
00661                 else {
00662                     en_array = new EGS_Float [nbin];
00663                     ibin=0;
00664                 }
00665                 for (int j=0; j<nbin; j++) {
00666                     sdata >> en_array[ibin++] >> skipsep >> f_array[j];
00667                     if (sdata.eof() || sdata.fail() || !sdata.good()) {
00668                         egsWarning("%s error on line %d in spectrum file %s\n",
00669                                    spec_msg1,j+2,spec_file.c_str());
00670                         if (delete_it) {
00671                             delete inp;
00672                         }
00673                         delete [] en_array;
00674                         delete [] f_array;
00675                         return 0;
00676                     }
00677                     if (mode != 2 && ibin > 1) {
00678                         if (en_array[ibin-1] <= en_array[ibin-2]) {
00679                             egsWarning("%s energies must be in increasing "
00680                                        "order.\n   This is not the case for input on "
00681                                        "lines %d,%d in spectrum file %s\n",
00682                                        spec_msg1,j+2,j+1,spec_file.c_str());
00683                             if (delete_it) {
00684                                 delete inp;
00685                             }
00686                             return 0;
00687                         }
00688                     }
00689                     if (mode == 0) {
00690                         f_array[j]/=(en_array[ibin-1]-en_array[ibin-2]);
00691                     }
00692                 }
00693                 int itype = 1;
00694                 if (mode == 2) {
00695                     itype = 0;
00696                 }
00697                 else if (mode == 3) {
00698                     itype = 2;
00699                 }
00700                 int nb = itype == 1 ? nbin+1 : nbin;
00701                 spec = new EGS_TabulatedSpectrum(nb,en_array,f_array,itype,
00702                                                  spec_file.c_str());
00703                 delete [] en_array;
00704                 delete [] f_array;
00705             }
00706         }
00707         else {
00708             vector<EGS_Float> eners, probs;
00709             int itype=1;
00710             int err1 = inp->getInput("energies",eners);
00711             int err2 = inp->getInput("probabilities",probs);
00712             int err3 = inp->getInput("spectrum type",itype);
00713 
00714             if (err1 || err2) {
00715                 if (err1) egsWarning("%s wrong/missing 'energies' input\n",
00716                                          spec_msg1);
00717                 if (err2) egsWarning("%s wrong/missing 'probabilities' "
00718                                          "input\n",spec_msg1);
00719             }
00720             else {
00721                 if (itype == 1 && probs.size() != eners.size()-1)
00722                     egsWarning("%s for spectrum type 1 the number of energies"
00723                                " must be the number of probabilities + 1\n",
00724                                spec_msg1);
00725                 else if ((itype == 0 || itype == 2) &&
00726                          probs.size() != eners.size())
00727                     egsWarning("%s for spectrum types 0 and 2 the number of "
00728                                "energies must be equal to the number of probabilities\n",
00729                                spec_msg1);
00730                 else {
00731                     int nbin = eners.size();
00732                     int nbin1 = itype == 1 ? nbin-1 : nbin;
00733                     EGS_Float *x = new EGS_Float [nbin],
00734                     *f = new EGS_Float [nbin1];
00735                     int ibin = 0;
00736                     if (itype == 1) {
00737                         ibin = 1;
00738                         x[0] = eners[0];
00739                     }
00740                     egsWarning("type = %d nbin = %d nbin1 = %d\n",itype,
00741                                nbin,nbin1);
00742                     for (int j=0; j<nbin1; j++) {
00743                         x[ibin] = eners[ibin];
00744                         f[j] = probs[j];
00745                         ibin++;
00746                         egsWarning("%d %d %g\n",j,ibin,x[ibin-1]);
00747                         if (itype != 0 && ibin > 1) {
00748                             if (x[ibin-1] <= x[ibin-2]) {
00749                                 egsWarning("%s energies must be given in "
00750                                            "increasing order\n  This is not the case"
00751                                            " for inputs %d and %d (%g,%g) %d\n",
00752                                            spec_msg1,ibin-2,ibin-1,x[ibin-2],x[ibin-1],
00753                                            j);
00754                                 if (delete_it) {
00755                                     delete inp;
00756                                 }
00757                                 delete [] x;
00758                                 delete [] f;
00759                                 return 0;
00760                             }
00761                         }
00762                     }
00763                     spec = new EGS_TabulatedSpectrum(nbin,x,f,itype,0);
00764                     delete [] x;
00765                     delete [] f;
00766                 }
00767             }
00768         }
00769     }
00770     else {
00771         egsWarning("%s unknown spectrum type %s\n",spec_msg1,stype.c_str());
00772     }
00773     if (delete_it) {
00774         delete inp;
00775     }
00776     return spec;
00777 }
